sub_topic: Determining the isomerism of a molecule
message_1: What is the isomerism of the molecule CH3CH=CHCH3 and how many isomers it has?
message_2:
The molecule CH3CH=CHCH3 is an alkene with the molecular formula C4H8. The isomerism exhibited by this molecule is geometrical isomerism (cis-trans isomerism) due to the presence of a carbon-carbon double bond.

There are two isomers of this molecule:

1. (Z)-but-2-ene (cis-but-2-ene): In this isomer, the two methyl (CH3) groups are on the same side of the double bond.
2. (E)-but-2-ene (trans-but-2-ene): In this isomer, the two methyl (CH3) groups are on opposite sides of the double bond.

So, the molecule CH3CH=CHCH3 has two isomers.
